org.gearvrf

Interface GVRShaders<ID>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GVRConsole, GVRMaterial, GVRPostEffect

    public interface GVRShaders<ID>
    The API shared by GVRMaterial and GVRPostEffect.

    GVRMaterialShaderManager implements GVRShaderManagers GVRMaterialMap implements GVRShaderMaps GVRMaterial implements GVRShaders
    GVRPostEffectShaderManager implements GVRShaderManagers GVRPostEffectMap implements GVRShaderMaps GVRPostEffect implements GVRShaders

    • Method Detail

      • getShaderType

        ID getShaderType()
        Returns:
        The current shader id.

      • setShaderType

        void setShaderType(ID shaderId)
        Set shader id
        Parameters:
        shaderId - The new shader id. This is an opaque type, used to keep object and scene shader ids in distinct namespaces.

      • getMainTexture

        GVRTexture getMainTexture()
        The texture currently bound to the main_texture shader uniform. With most shaders, this is the texture that is actually displayed.
        Returns:
        The main texture

      • setMainTexture

        void setMainTexture(GVRTexture texture)
        Bind a different texture to the main_texture shader uniform.

        Note: GVR textures are reference counted. While you can freely change the texture associated with a GVRMaterial or a GVRPostEffect, a sequence like 

         GVRTexture currentTexture = material.getMainTexture();
 material.setMainTexture(otherTexture);
 // ...
 material.setMainTexture(currentTexture);
        may not do what you expect. The setMainTexture(otherTexture) call will decrement the reference count on currentTexture: If the reference count goes to 0, the texture will be released, and the setMainTexture(currentTexture) call will leave the GVRMaterial invisible (or will break the GVRPostEffect). You can prevent this by adding a new reference 
         material.setTexture("any_name_you're_not_otherwise_using", currentTexture);
        before you call setMainTexture(otherTexture).
        Parameters:
        texture - The GVRTexture to bind.

      • setMainTexture

        void setMainTexture(java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture> texture)
        Asynchronously bind a different texture to the main_texture shader uniform. Uses a background thread from the thread pool to wait for the Future.get() method; unless you are loading dozens of textures asynchronously, the extra overhead should be modest compared to the cost of loading a texture.

        Please see the notes on reference counting in the main setMainTexture(GVRTexture) overload.

        Parameters:
        texture - A future texture, from one of the the GVRContext.loadFutureTexture(GVRAndroidResource) methods
        Since:
        1.6.7

      • getTexture

        GVRTexture getTexture(java.lang.String key)
        Get the texture currently bound to the shader uniform key.
        Parameters:
        key - A texture name
        Returns:
        The current texture.

      • setTexture

        void setTexture(java.lang.String key,
                GVRTexture texture)
        Bind a texture to the shader uniform key.

        Note that this will increment the reference count of the new texture, and decrement the reference count of any current texture. See setMainTexture(GVRTexture) for more details.

        Parameters:
        key - Name of the shader uniform to bind the texture to.
        texture - The texture to bind.

      • setTexture

        void setTexture(java.lang.String key,
                java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture> texture)
        Asynchronously bind a texture to the shader uniform key. Uses a background thread from the thread pool to wait for the Future.get() method; unless you are loading dozens of textures asynchronously, the extra overhead should be modest compared to the cost of loading a texture.

        Note that this will increment the reference count of the new texture, and decrement the reference count of any current texture. See setMainTexture(GVRTexture) for more details.

        Parameters:
        key - Name of the shader uniform to bind the texture to.
        texture - The texture to bind.
        Since:
        1.6.7
